body.p: Messrs Gélard and Leisenring support the disclosure of information to enable users of financial statements to evaluate the activities of an entity and the economic environment in which it operates. However, they believe that the IFRS will not meet this objective, even with the required disclosures and reconciliation to the entity’s annual financial statements, because it does not define segment profit or loss and does not require consistent attribution of assets and profit or loss to segments.
